title: How signals are generated and published
inline_microcopy:
About signal visibility:
Our AI scans the market every hour. To keep alerts readable, only higher-confidence signals are published more widely as Discord posts or notifications. All actionable signals are shown here.

items.question: Why do signals start at 10:00 ET?
items.answer: We deliberately hold new signals, Discord alerts, and auto-executions until 10:00 ET. The opening auction (9:30–9:45) is the most chaotic part of the session—liquidity is thinner, quotes are stale, and spoofing bots can whip prices dozens of basis points in seconds. Waiting until 10:00 ET lets spreads tighten, dark-pool prints settle, and primary market depth normalize so the AI is acting on clean data instead of noise. If you trade before 10:00 ET you’re taking risk the platform is explicitly designed to avoid.

items.question: Why don’t I see every signal as an alert?
items.answer: Our AI scans the market every hour and evaluates all opportunities. To keep alerts useful and readable, only higher-confidence signals are published more widely to Discord or notifications. All actionable signals remain visible inside the app and website.

items.question: Does the AI still trade signals I don’t see?
items.answer: Yes. The AI model portfolio trades all qualified signals. Visibility does not affect performance or results.

items.question: What does the confidence score mean?
items.answer: The confidence score reflects how many technical and market conditions align at the time a signal is generated. Signals above 60% confidence are considered actionable.

items.question: Can a signal appear later even if it didn’t at first?
items.answer: Yes. If market conditions improve, a signal can upgrade itself with higher confidence and be highlighted more widely.

items.question: Am I missing trading opportunities?
items.answer: No. The AI never stops scanning or trading. This system only controls how signals are shown, not how the AI operates.
